title: Chris Wilder issues challenge to Sheffield United goalkeeper Dean Henderson
text:

Chris Wilder has challenged Dean Henderson to build on his first England call-up by making his Three Lions debut.

Wilder claimed Henderson’s call-up by Gareth Southgate was recognition of the on-loan Manchester United goalkeeper’s progress with Sheffield United.

The Blades boss has told him he must push on and has set the Under-21 star the target of making his full England debut.

“He’s working extremely hard and I’m delighted he got his reward with England,” said Wilder.

“It was a reward for not just a good start to his Premier League season, but his performances right the way through and for England at international level before.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

“The next step now is to stay in the squad and to try and make his full debut. He will only do that by playing very well for us.

“He has to keep improving and taking his game to the next level, which is playing for the national side and doing very well for us.

“When that happens, we will only know with time.”

Wilder was not surprised by Henderson’s claims that he can become the world’s best goalkeeper and says the 22-year-old is full of self-belief.

Rather than cockiness, Wilder sees his self-confidence as a positive because it enabled him to bounce back from his mistake against Liverpool by impressing at Watford .

(Image: REUTERS)

“He’s a confident boy, he backs himself to do well,” he said.

“I’m not surprised he’s saying these words. If they came from someone else, I might have a different view, but knowing what the boy is about, I smile. I love it, I love his positivity.

“I love his reaction as shown against Watford and the way he will work and work to be the best he can.

“If he works as hard as he can, then you never know where that can take you.”
description: The Manchester United loanee was called up to Gareth Southgate's most recent England squad
